subject: Science
title: Convergent Evolution: Same Problem, Same Answer
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Convergent Evolution: Same Problem, Same Answer.

hook.text: Sharks, dolphins, and ichthyosaurs all look alike. But they're barely related.

buildup.text: All three evolved streamlined bodies independently because water demands that shape.

discovery.text: This is convergent evolution: unrelated species evolving similar solutions to the same problem.

twist.text: Eyes evolved independently over 40 times in different animal lineages.

climax.text: Even the camera eye of an octopus evolved separately from the camera eye of a human.

punchline.text: Evolution keeps reinventing the same designs. The problems of physics don't change.

quiz.question: What is convergent evolution?
options: Unrelated species evolving similar traits independently
Species becoming more different over time
